column9: Used medication for prostate infection after a biopsy (in the hospital)it took 6 bags of 50 ml each to control the infection. No side effects, started to get better after the third bag treatment.

column1: Infection of a Joint caused by Staphylococcus Aureus
column2: 55-64 Male  (Patient)
column9: had to have a daily infusion for 38 days

column2: 3 dogs 1 cat, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I had been ill one month with an UTI.  My doctor finally ran a second culture (at my insistance) and determined the infection needed to be treated with Rocephin.  It worked I feel as if I have my life back.  The only downside was I had to go into the drs. office everyday for ten days for an injection.

column2: Jeanine, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Caregiver)
column9: This injection nearly killed my mother-in-law 3 days ago. After being injected she immediately became lightheaded and went into a seizure,and stopped breathing. Thank God she was at the doctors office! They were able to bring her back. It shot her heart rate up to 150 beats per min,her eyes were rolled up in head and she could barely breath! I thought for sure she was gonna die. She looked horrible and struggled for 5 hours before being able to get her breathing to her normal rate. She spent a day in ICU,and another day in the hospital. I would NOT recommend this medication to anyone. Her pharmacist told me that her son almost died from this medication too,and that it is known to cause allergic reactions in a high percentage of people.

column1: Bacteria causing an Infection in the Joints
column2: PJ, 75 or over Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: About two years ago I was diagnosed with Whipples Disease. This is a very rare disease which attacks various parts of your body causing joint pain, vomiting, diahrea, dry mouth, etc;. The prescribed dose was daily infusions to be administered at a hospital or clinic. I chose my local clinic and received daily treatment six times a week for a solid year.At first I was skeptical but after a  few months I could see some results. I completed treatment earlier this year and I'm considered cured, although I still get tired very easily. Overall I'm very happy with the results.

column1: Lyme Disease of the Central Nervous System
column2: Cat-in-the-Hat, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: This is the only med that has helped treat my Lyme. It is a bit hardcore to inject 3cc into each thigh everyday and to herx, but at least I know its working. I take the 2gram.

column2: Christyn36, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I was on Rocephin IV x 1 month and went to the ER twice the first month for chest pain. They said it was related to the Lymes Disease. Five months later, I am still having the chest pain. I saw my family doctor several times. Finally I got referred to GI for an EGD. I come to find out the med caused me to get Gastric and duodenal ulcers :( The medicine worked but the side effects after teh fact still have me seeking medicaL treatment.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Good

column2: 7jacob7, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I received an injection of rocephin on 7/22/10.Within 1 hour i was in severe pain in my thighs and arms. It was so bad i ended up in the emergency room. On sat.7/24/10 i was admitted to the hospital. They gave me iv vancomicyn which made things worse. It has now been 10 weeks and i am still in pain and have severe numbness in my right leg from my knee to my ankle, numbness in both arms and numbness above my left knee. My doctor swears it was not from rocephin but can't tell me what caused it. I haven't been able to work for ten weeks. Please Help.

column1: Lyme Disease of the Central Nervous System
column2: infected1, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: This medication has helped me with many of my lyme symptons. I was unable to walk before treatment and am now walking.

column2: symptomatic again, 35-44 on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: spent 30 days on iv and lost 30 pounds within the following month 1/2 stayed in remission for 6 years and am about to go back on it again for bartonella since it was undiagnosed before and i have the same symptoms now and it kept it under wraps for so many years, it gave me absolutely no side effects whatsoever, it was easier than the oral antibio, it just costs more. not the drug itself but having the iv inserted and nurse f/u.

column2: Jake, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I was sick for 2 weeks with a lower respiratory infection before I went to seemy doctor.  He gave me a shot of Rocephin around noon and I was 100% better the next day.  I had no side effects as mentioned by others on this site.

column1: Urinary Tract Infection due to E. Coli Bacteria

column9: This medication made me so sick. All I had was a UTI. They gave me this at the ER and I got dizziness, confusion, agitation, slurred speech, I thought I was going to have a seizure!

column2: snowflake, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Immediate severe, instant, adverse reaction with burning of eyelids, lips, tongue, mouth, face, skin on arms, shoulders and stomach. I thought I would die, the feeling of burning was so bad. I felt dizzy, like I would pass out, and within 5 minutes I had to have a bowel movement. I was given an anti-histamine injection and the symptoms subsided after about 15 minutes. I would NEVER take this drug again!

column9: received Rocephin IV in hospital emergency care.  Severe allergic reaction within two minutes of IV administration!  Eyes swelledup, as did half my face.  Throat started to swell, as well as hives.  Ears and nose itching severe.  Nurse took out IV, thenadministered a benedryl type drug thru IV!Breathing machines!  A flurry of docs in & out!  Terrible experience.   1 week now, eyelids still somewhat swollen!

column2: fisherman, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Inflamation and soreness in a cut in the gum was relatively unchanged; soreness persisted even though my chest was cleared of congestion that largely, was not a problem before the injection.

column2: send2jayce, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I was also diagnoses about 3 years prior to Lyme with MS.  I am GRAVELY allergic to Rocephin but was forced into the ICU for desinsitization to the drug since it was my only treatment option(allergic Penecillin too).So far desensitization seems successful, though initial 48 hours in ICU were a little rough.  2 weeks into another 4 weeks of treatment and the swollen Lyme arthritic knees are healing and I can walk again without tremendous pain.  So far so good.  Just wanted to share my apparent success with temporarily disarming my ROcephin allergy with my immunologist, and a fleet of doctors and nurses to get the treatment I needed desperately.

column1: Skin Infection due to Staphylococcus Epidermidis Bacteria
column2: Maducesa, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I had to have a IV 3 times with this stuff due to a bad skin infection that turned the skin around it to cellulitis. Please be carfull this drug it gave me C. difficile (a severe infection of the colon). You think i would have learned after the first time but no i did it again. Now i have a sensitivity to alot of antibiotics not fun with cronic skin infections.

column1: Blood Infection caused by Staphylococcus Bacteria
column2: iria32, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I got a severe rash on my arms, hands and legs from this drug given IV. From my knees down it was the worst, large blisters that left scars. It started as tiny red spots on my thighs. No one listened when I told them it could be an allergic reaction, and all the doctors that saw it said they had never seen a Rocephin rash that bad before.Needless to say it's now on my drug allergy list.
